detaileddescription.para: Pixel format is big-endian.
Pixel format has a palette in data[1], values are indexes in this palette.
All values of a component are bit-wise packed end to end.
Pixel format is an HW accelerated format.
At least one pixel component is not in the first data plane.
The pixel format contains RGB-like data (as opposed to YUV/grayscale).
The pixel format has an alpha channel. This is set on all formats that support alpha in some way, including AV_PIX_FMT_PAL8. The alpha is always straight, never pre-multiplied.

If a codec or a filter does not support alpha, it should set all alpha to opaque, or use the equivalent pixel formats without alpha component, e.g. AV_PIX_FMT_RGB0 (or AV_PIX_FMT_RGB24 etc.) instead of AV_PIX_FMT_RGBA.
The pixel format is following a Bayer pattern
The pixel format contains IEEE-754 floating point values. Precision (double, single, or half) should be determined by the pixel size (64, 32, or 16 bits).
The pixel format contains XYZ-like data (as opposed to YUV/RGB/grayscale).
loss due to resolution change
loss due to color depth change
loss due to color space conversion
loss of alpha bits
loss due to color quantization
loss of chroma (e.g. RGB to gray conversion)
loss due to unneeded extra resolution
loss due to unneeded extra color depth
Descriptor that unambiguously describes how the bits of a pixel are stored in the up to 4 data planes of an image. It also stores the subsampling factors and number of components.

simplesect.para: This is separate of the colorspace (RGB, YCbCr, YPbPr, JPEG-style YUV and all the YUV variants) AVPixFmtDescriptor just stores how values are stored not what these values represent.

detaileddescription.para: Return the number of bits per pixel used by the pixel format described by pixdesc. Note that this is not the same as the number of bits per sample.
The returned number of bits refers to the number of bits actually used for storing the pixel information, that is padding bits are not counted.
Return the number of bits per pixel for the pixel format described by pixdesc, including any padding or unused bits.

simplesect.para: a pixel format descriptor for provided pixel format or NULL if this pixel format is unknown.

detaileddescription.para: Iterate over all pixel format descriptors known to libavutil.

parameterdescription.para: previous descriptor. NULL to get the first descriptor.

simplesect.para: next descriptor or NULL after the last descriptor
an AVPixelFormat id described by desc, or AV_PIX_FMT_NONE if desc is not a valid pointer to a pixel format descriptor.

detaileddescription.para: Utility function to access log2_chroma_w log2_chroma_h from the pixel format AVPixFmtDescriptor.

parameterdescription.para: the pixel format
store log2_chroma_w (horizontal/width shift)
store log2_chroma_h (vertical/height shift)

simplesect.para: 0 on success, AVERROR(ENOSYS) on invalid or unknown pixel format
number of planes in pix_fmt, a negative AVERROR if pix_fmt is not a valid pixel format.
the name for provided color range or NULL if unknown.
the AVColorRange value for name or an AVError if not found.
the name for provided color primaries or NULL if unknown.
the AVColorPrimaries value for name or an AVError if not found.
the name for provided color transfer or NULL if unknown.
the AVColorTransferCharacteristic value for name or an AVError if not found.
the name for provided color space or NULL if unknown.
the AVColorSpace value for name or an AVError if not found.
the name for provided chroma location or NULL if unknown.
the AVChromaLocation value for name or an AVError if not found.

detaileddescription.para: Converts AVChromaLocation to swscale x/y chroma position.
The positions represent the chroma (0,0) position in a coordinates system with luma (0,0) representing the origin and luma(1,1) representing 256,256

parameterdescription.para: horizontal chroma sample position
vertical chroma sample position

detaileddescription.para: Converts swscale x/y chroma position to AVChromaLocation.
The positions represent the chroma (0,0) position in a coordinates system with luma (0,0) representing the origin and luma(1,1) representing 256,256

parameterdescription.para: horizontal chroma sample position
vertical chroma sample position

simplesect.para: the name for provided alpha mode or NULL if unknown.
the AVAlphaMode value for name or an AVError if not found.

detaileddescription.para: Return the pixel format corresponding to name.

If there is no pixel format with name name, then looks for a pixel format with the name corresponding to the native endian format of name. For example in a little-endian system, first looks for "gray16", then for "gray16le".
Finally if no pixel format has been found, returns AV_PIX_FMT_NONE.
Return the short name for a pixel format, NULL in case pix_fmt is unknown.

simplesect.para: av_get_pix_fmt(), av_get_pix_fmt_string()

detaileddescription.para: Print in buf the string corresponding to the pixel format with number pix_fmt, or a header if pix_fmt is negative.

parameterdescription.para: the buffer where to write the string
the size of buf
the number of the pixel format to print the corresponding info string, or a negative value to print the corresponding header.

memberdef.name: av_read_image_line2

detaileddescription.para: Read a line from an image, and write the values of the pixel format component c to dst.

parameterdescription.para: the array containing the pointers to the planes of the image
the array containing the linesizes of the image
the pixel format descriptor for the image
the horizontal coordinate of the first pixel to read
the vertical coordinate of the first pixel to read
the width of the line to read, that is the number of values to write to dst

if not zero and the format is a paletted format writes the values corresponding to the palette component c in data[1] to dst, rather than the palette indexes in data[0]. The behavior is undefined if the format is not paletted.
size of elements in dst array (2 or 4 byte)

detaileddescription.para: Utility function to swap the endianness of a pixel format.

parameterdescription.para: the pixel format

simplesect.para: pixel format with swapped endianness if it exists, otherwise AV_PIX_FMT_NONE

memberdef.argsstring: (enum AVPixelFormat dst_pix_fmt, enum AVPixelFormat src_pix_fmt, int has_alpha)
memberdef.name: av_get_pix_fmt_loss

detaileddescription.para: Compute what kind of losses will occur when converting from one specific pixel format to another. When converting from one pixel format to another, information loss may occur. For example, when converting from RGB24 to GRAY, the color information will be lost. Similarly, other losses occur when converting from some formats to other formats. These losses can involve loss of chroma, but also loss of resolution, loss of color depth, loss due to the color space conversion, loss of the alpha bits or loss due to color quantization. av_get_fix_fmt_loss() informs you about the various types of losses which will occur when converting from one pixel format to another.

parameterdescription.para: destination pixel format
source pixel format
Whether the source pixel format alpha channel is used.

simplesect.para: Combination of flags informing you what kind of losses will occur (maximum loss for an invalid dst_pix_fmt).

memberdef.argsstring: (enum AVPixelFormat dst_pix_fmt1, enum AVPixelFormat dst_pix_fmt2, enum AVPixelFormat src_pix_fmt, int has_alpha, int *loss_ptr)
memberdef.name: av_find_best_pix_fmt_of_2

detaileddescription.para: Compute what kind of losses will occur when converting from one specific pixel format to another. When converting from one pixel format to another, information loss may occur. For example, when converting from RGB24 to GRAY, the color information will be lost. Similarly, other losses occur when converting from some formats to other formats. These losses can involve loss of chroma, but also loss of resolution, loss of color depth, loss due to the color space conversion, loss of the alpha bits or loss due to color quantization. av_get_fix_fmt_loss() informs you about the various types of losses which will occur when converting from one pixel format to another.

parameterdescription.para: destination pixel format
source pixel format
Whether the source pixel format alpha channel is used.

simplesect.para: Combination of flags informing you what kind of losses will occur (maximum loss for an invalid dst_pix_fmt).
